message.content:
I'll calculate the requested financial ratios based on the three financial statements provided. Let me solve this step by step.

## Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = $7,660,411.14 / $3,054,996.05 = 2.51

## Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = ($1,559,920.95 / $7,099,920.95) × 100% = 21.97%

## Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
Debt to Asset Ratio = $3,054,996.05 / $14,879,933.86 = 0.21

## Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = (-$1,175,062.19 / $7,099,920.95) × 100% = -16.55%

## Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) / Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = ($145,666.48 + $194,711.58) / $3,054,996.05 = $340,378.06 / $3,054,996.05 = 0.11

## Free Cash Flow (FCF)
From the cash flow statement, the Net Increase in cash is -$7,659,621.94, which represents the FCF

## Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = (-$1,175,062.19 / $14,879,933.86) × 100% = -7.90%

{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '2.51', 'Gross Profit Margin': '21.97%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.21', 'Net Profit Margin': '-16.55%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '0.11', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-7659621.94', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '-7.90%'} }
